message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest herpes zoster (shingles), and the vesicular rash confirms the diagnosis. Famciclovir is the treatment of choice for herpes zoster, and it can prevent postherpetic neuralgia, a complication of shingles. Prednisone can be used in combination with famciclovir in severe cases, but it is not the first-line treatment. Valganciclovir is used to treat cytomegalovirus and is not indicated in this case. Gabapentin is used for neuropathic pain but is not the first-line treatment for shingles.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The pain, rash, and distribution suggest herpes zoster (shingles). Famciclovir is the antiviral medication used to treat shingles and prevent complications such as postherpetic neuralgia. Prednisone is not recommended for routine use in shingles, but may be used in selected cases. Valganciclovir is used to treat cytomegalovirus infections and Gabapentin is used to treat neuropathic pain, but they are not indicated in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The vesicular rash distributed along a dermatome suggests herpes zoster (shingles), which is caused by varicella-zoster virus. Famciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat herpes zoster and prevent complications such as postherpetic neuralgia. Prednisone may be used to reduce inflammation and pain associated with herpes zoster, but it is not a first-line treatment. Valganciclovir is used to treat cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections, which are not related to herpes zoster. Gabapentin may be used to treat postherpetic neuralgia, but it is not a first-line treatment for active herpes zoster.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the vesicular rash along the T4 dermatome suggest herpes zoster, commonly known as shingles. Famciclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat and prevent complications of herpes zoster. Prednisone is used to reduce inflammation but is not the first-line treatment for herpes zoster. Valganciclovir is used for cytomegalovirus infections and Gabapentin is used for neuropathic pain, which may occur later in the course of shingles.

Valganciclovir is used to treat cytomegalovirus infections and not herpes zoster. Gabapentin is used to treat neuropathic pain, but it is not the primary treatment for herpes zoster.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and vesicular rash distributed along the T4 dermatome suggest herpes zoster. Famciclovir is an antiviral medication that can effectively treat herpes zoster and prevent further complications. Prednisone is sometimes used to reduce inflammation and pain, but it should not be used without antiviral medication to avoid further complications. Valganciclovir is used to treat viral infections caused by cytomegalovirus, which is not relevant in this case. Gabapentin is used for neuropathic pain, which may be helpful for the patient’s symptoms, but it does not treat the underlying condition of herpes zoster.
